label: CP Phase δ_CP (Normal Ordering)
mathematical_goal: Derive the leptonic CP-violating phase δ_CP = 220.5° from G₂ topological matching conditions, comparing to NuFIT 6.0 NO (232.5° ± 26.7°)
theoretical_significance: δ_CP governs CP violation in neutrino oscillations, crucial for leptogenesis and the matter-antimatter asymmetry. Unlike the CKM phase (~60°), the PMNS δ_CP is near 3π/2, indicating near-maximal CP violation in the lepton sector. In PM, δ_CP emerges from the phase structure of G₂ holonomy: the term (N_gen + b₂)/(2N_gen) = 17/6 represents the mixing between generation index and harmonic 2-forms, while N_gen/b₃ = 3/24 = 1/8 is the saturation ratio of 3-forms. The product with π converts topological ratios to geometric phases. PM predicts δ_CP ≈ 220°, agreeing with NOvA/T2K data at <0.5σ level. This is a parameter-free prediction of CP violation strength.

leptogenesis.PM_mechanism: Resonant leptogenesis from degenerate right-handed neutrinos

derivation_chain: Topological phase matching on K=4 fibres
